channel.title: JaneBytes Cybersecurity Feed
channel.description: Summarized articles from top cybersecurity sources.

item.title: 10 Best Network Monitoring Tools in 2025
item.description: This article provides an overview of the best network monitoring tools in 2025 for various business sizes and technical requirements. The tools reviewed include SolarWinds NPM, PRTG Network Monitor, ManageEngine OpManager, Nagios XI, Zabbix, Datadog, LogicMonitor, Site24x7, Auvik, and Netreo. Each tool is evaluated based on its core functionality, scalability and flexibility, alerting and automation, user experience (UX), community and support, and pricing and value.

item.title: GeoServer Exploits, PolarEdge, and Gayfemboy Push Cybercrime Beyond Traditional Botnets
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: OSGeo GeoServer; CVE(s): CVE-2024-36401; Summary: A critical remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-36401, CVSS score 9.8) in OSGeo GeoServer's GeoTools has been weaponized to deploy legitimate software development kits (SDKs) or modified apps on Redis servers, allowing attackers to generate passive income via network sharing or residential proxies.
FYSA: The article highlights multiple campaigns exploiting known security vulnerabilities and compromising Redis servers for various malicious activities, including IoT botnets, residential proxies, and cryptocurrency mining infrastructure.

item.title: Murky Panda hackers exploit cloud trust to hack downstream customers
item.description: Murky Panda, a Chinese state-sponsored hacking group, exploits trusted relationships in cloud environments to gain initial access to networks and data of downstream customers. They compromise cloud service providers to abuse the trust these companies have with their customers, allowing them to pivot directly into downstream networks and data.

item.title: Agentic AI vs SOAR: What’s the Real Difference?
item.description: The article discusses the differences between Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) and Agentic AI in security automation. SOAR focuses on structured workflow automation, while Agentic AI uses objectives to make decisions and adapt to complex situations. The key takeaway is that SOAR is suitable for repetitive, low-risk tasks, but Agentic AI is better suited for handling complexity and uncertainty.

item.title: APT36 hackers abuse Linux .desktop files to install malware in new attacks
item.description: APT36, a Pakistani cyberespionage group, is using Linux .desktop files to load malware in attacks against government and defense entities in India. The attacks involve phishing emails with ZIP archives containing malicious .desktop files that disguise as PDF documents, leading to data exfiltration and persistent espionage access.

item.title: Hackers Hijack VPS Servers to Breach Software-as-a-Service Accounts
item.description: Threat actors are exploiting Virtual Private Servers (VPS) to orchestrate stealthy attacks against Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) environments. They use VPS providers like Hyonix and Host Universal to mimic legitimate local traffic, evade detection, and blend malicious activities with normal user behavior.

item.title: Help TDS Hacks Legitimate Websites, Using PHP Templates to Display Fake Microsoft Security Alerts
item.description: This article discusses the Help TDS (Traffic Direction System), a sophisticated malware operation that exploits compromised websites to redirect visitors to fraudulent pages. The system uses advanced browser manipulation techniques, including full-screen takeovers and exit prevention scripts, to trap users into calling fake tech support lines and demanding payments for bogus cleanup services.

item.title: Fake Mac fixes trick users into installing new Shamos infostealer
item.description: Vulnerable Product: COOKIE SPIDER; CVE(s): None; Summary: Shamos, a new variant of the Atomic macOS Stealer (AMOS), targets Mac devices through ClickFix attacks that impersonate troubleshooting guides and fixes. The malware steals data and credentials stored in web browsers, Keychain items, Apple Notes, and cryptocurrency wallets by executing shell commands in the macOS Terminal.

item.title: Lumma Operators Deploy Cutting-Edge Evasion Tools to Maintain Stealth and Persistence
item.description: The report by Insikt Group reveals the complex operating framework of Lumma infostealer affiliates, highlighting their use of cutting-edge evasion technologies to support cybercrime operations. The analysis identifies specific affiliates and tactics, including the reliance on residential proxy services, VPNs, anti-detection browsers, and outsourced evasion services. The report also warns about the need for continued law enforcement efforts and employee training to counter this resilient threat landscape.

item.title: Linux Malware Delivered via Malicious RAR Filenames Evades Antivirus Detection
item.description: The article discusses a novel attack chain that delivers an open-source backdoor called VShell through phishing emails. The malware uses shell command injection and Base64-encoded Bash payloads to execute arbitrary code, exploiting file names evaluated with inadequate sanitization in shell scripts.

item.title: BQTLOCK Ransomware-as-a-Service Emerges, Boasting Sophisticated Evasion Tactics
item.description: BQTLock is a ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) that employs double extortion tactics, encrypting files with a .bqtlock extension and threatening data leaks if ransoms are not paid. It integrates anti-analysis measures, escalates privileges, performs process hollowing, and disables Windows mechanisms to hinder recovery.

item.title: What Are Deep Web Threat Intelligence Solutions?
item.description: The article discusses the concept of the deep web, which is not inherently malicious but rather refers to private, non-indexed resources on the internet. It highlights the importance of monitoring the deep web for early warning intelligence and preventing fraud, compliance violations, and credential abuse.

item.title: Surface Web Vs Deep Web Vs Dark Web
item.description: The article explains the differences between the Surface Web, Deep Web, and Dark Web, highlighting their unique features, content types, and risks. It emphasizes the importance of understanding these layers for safe browsing and smart online interactions. The article also provides tips on how to navigate each layer securely.

item.title: ClickFix Exploit Emerges: Microsoft Flags Cross-Platform Attacks Targeting Windows and macOS
item.description: The article highlights the rising threat of the ClickFix social engineering technique, which targets users with fake technical glitches and convinces them to execute malicious commands, bypassing traditional security defenses. Threat actors use various tactics such as phishing, malvertising, and drive-by compromises to deliver payloads like infostealers, remote access trojans, and rootkits.

item.title: Data Encryption: A Key Strategy in Protecting Sensitive Information
item.description: None. This article is not about a vulnerability but provides an overview of the importance of data encryption in today's cybersecurity landscape. It discusses various aspects of encryption, including its types, algorithms, tools, and best practices for implementing robust encryption. The article also touches on the role of decryption, key management, and the need for effective encryption to thwart unauthorized access and ensure data integrity across industries.

item.title: Anatsa Malware Escalates: Android Under Siege as Hackers Harvest Credentials and Track Keystrokes
item.description: Anatsa malware (also known as TeaBot) is an Android banking trojan that has evolved to target over 831 financial institutions worldwide, including new regions like Germany and South Korea. It employs decoy applications, dynamic code loading, runtime decryption, and anti-analysis enhancements to evade detection and exfiltrate credentials.

item.title: CISA Warns of Actively Exploited 0-Day Vulnerability in Apple iOS, iPadOS, and macOS
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apple; CVE(s): CVE-2025-43300; Summary: A critical zero-day vulnerability in Apple's Image I/O framework (CVE-2025-43300) is being actively exploited. The out-of-bounds write vulnerability allows attackers to execute arbitrary code, potentially leading to system compromise. It affects iOS, iPadOS, and macOS systems and poses a significant security risk to millions of users.

item.title: Microsoft: August Windows updates cause severe streaming issues
item.description: The August 2025 security updates for Windows 10 and Windows 11 are causing severe lag and stuttering issues with NDI streaming software on some systems, affecting streaming apps like OBS.

item.title: Microsoft to Restrict Use of OnMicrosoft Domains for Email Sending
item.description: Microsoft has implemented new throttling measures to combat spam and improve email deliverability across its Microsoft 365 platform by restricting the use of default onmicrosoft.com domains for email communication. The change aims to prevent spammers from exploiting newly created tenants to send large volumes of spam, which degrades the shared domain's reputation.

item.title: Agentic AI: Everything You Need to Know
item.description:
The article discusses the concept of agentic AI for threat intelligence, highlighting its benefits and security considerations. It provides an overview of the technology, including its potential to automate routine tasks, improve alert processing, and enhance threat analysis. The article also touches on the importance of human oversight, explainable AI outputs, and proper governance frameworks.
The text does not discuss a specific vulnerability in a product or system. Instead, it explores the concept of agentic AI for threat intelligence and provides guidance on its implementation and security considerations.
In summary, the response begins with 'FYSA: ' because the article is not discussing a specific vulnerability in a product or system, but rather exploring the concept of agentic AI for threat intelligence.

item.title: CISA Requests Public Comment for Updated Guidance on Software Bill of Materials
item.description: The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) released updated guidance for the Minimum Elements for a Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) for public comment, aiming to improve SBOM practices by refining data fields, automation support, and operational practices. Stakeholders are encouraged to provide feedback via the Federal Register during the public comment period, which concludes on October 3, 2025.

item.title: AI Systems Capable of Generating Working Exploits for CVEs in Just 10–15 Minutes
item.description: A cybersecurity research team has developed an artificial intelligence system that can automatically generate working exploits for published Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVEs) in just 10-15 minutes at approximately $1 per exploit. The system accelerates exploit development compared to manual human analysis, which typically provides defenders with hours, days, or even weeks of mitigation grace time.

item.title: Rogue Go Module Doubles as Fast SSH Brute-Forcer, Sends Stolen Passwords via Telegram
item.description: Vulnerable Product: golang-random-ip-ssh-bruteforce (Socket); CVE(s): None; Summary: This Go module, masquerading as an SSH brute-forcing tool, secretly exfiltrates stolen credentials to its creator by transmitting the target IP, username, and password to a Telegram bot. The module uses unwitting users to perform distributed scanning and guessing, offloading computational and legal risks while funneling successes to a single point of control.

item.title: Chinese Hackers Murky, Genesis, and Glacial Panda Escalate Cloud and Telecom Espionage
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: None; CVE(s): "None"; Summary: This article discusses malicious activity by the China-nexus cyber espionage group Murky Panda, which abuses trusted relationships in the cloud to breach enterprise networks. The group exploits internet-facing appliances, zero-day and known security flaws, and compromises small office/home office (SOHO) devices to obtain initial access and deploy web shells and malware.
FYSA: This article highlights the tactics used by Chinese hacking groups, including Murky Panda, Genesis Panda, and Glacial Panda, in targeting cloud environments for intelligence collection and data harvesting. These groups exploit vulnerabilities, compromise cloud-hosted systems, and use credentials obtained from compromised virtual machines to burrow deeper into target networks.

item.title: INTERPOL Arrests 1,209 Cybercriminals Across 18 African Nations in Global Crackdown
item.description: The INTERPOL-coordinated Operation Serengeti has resulted in the arrest of 1,209 cybercriminals across 18 countries in Africa, with a global impact including $97.4 million recovered and 11,432 malicious infrastructures dismantled. The operation targeted ransomware, online scams, and business email compromise (BEC).

item.title: Hackers Target Phones of Military-Linked Individuals in South Asia Using New Spy Tools
item.description: Cyber threat actors have launched sophisticated phishing operations aimed at military and government personnel in South Asia, leveraging defense-related lures to distribute malicious archives and applications. The operation extends beyond phishing to mobile espionage, with actors deploying modified versions of the open-source Rafel RAT via APK files.

item.title: Automation Is Redefining Pentest Delivery
item.description: This article discusses the importance of automating pentest (penetration test) delivery to improve efficiency, reduce delays, and enhance overall vulnerability management. It highlights the benefits of automation, including real-time actionability, faster response times, and improved focus for security teams. The article also provides guidance on how to begin automating pentest delivery, including mapping current workflows, identifying friction points, starting small, and choosing the right platform.

item.title: Massive anti-cybercrime operation leads to over 1,200 arrests in Africa
item.description: Law enforcement authorities in Africa have conducted a coordinated operation to target cross-border cybercriminal gangs, resulting in the arrest of over 1,200 suspects and seizure of $97.4 million worth of assets. The operation, called "Operation Serengeti 2.0," was led by INTERPOL and involved investigators from 18 African countries and the United Kingdom.

item.title: DaVita says ransomware gang stole data of nearly 2.7 million people
item.description: A ransomware gang, Interlock, breached DaVita's network, stealing the personal and health information of nearly 2.7 million individuals, including sensitive patient records, insurance details, user account information, and financial data. The attackers gained access to DaVita's systems on March 24 and were evicted after the company detected the incident on April 12.

item.title: Malicious PDFs in Play: UAC-0057 Leveraging Invitations to Trigger Shell Script Attacks
item.description: UAC-0057 (Belarusian-affiliated threat actor) has been using weaponized archives containing phony PDFs to target organizations in Poland and Ukraine. The campaign exploits Microsoft Excel spreadsheets with embedded VBA macros, which drop and execute malicious DLL implants for system reconnaissance and further payload deployment.

item.title: Stealth Threat Unpacked: Weaponized RAR Files Deliver VShell Backdoor on Linux Systems
item.description: The article discusses an infection chain that weaponizes a filename to compromise Linux hosts. The attack involves a spam message with a RAR archive that drops a Bash program whose name exploits the "process expansion" syntax in Bash, allowing for arbitrary command execution. The malware persists by expanding PATH and probing writable directories, and eventually downloads and executes a VShell remote-access tool, providing interactive reverse shells and other capabilities.

item.title: Azure Default API Connection Flaw Enables Full Cross-Tenant Compromise
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Azure API Connection; CVE(s): None; Summary: A critical vulnerability in Microsoft Azure's API Connection architecture allows attackers to compromise resources across different tenant environments, exposing sensitive data stored in Key Vaults, Azure SQL databases, and third-party services. Attackers can hijack any API Connection worldwide with full backend privileges by exploiting an undocumented DynamicInvoke endpoint that accepts custom paths, methods, headers, and request bodies.

item.title: Colt Confirms Ransomware Attack Resulted in Customer Data Theft
item.description: A recent ransomware attack on Colt's business support systems resulted in the theft of customer data, with threat actors accessing files containing customer-related information. The company implemented containment protocols, took affected systems offline, and engaged external cybersecurity specialists to conduct a comprehensive forensic analysis.

item.title: NIST Releases New Control Overlays to Manage Cybersecurity Risks in AI Systems
item.description: NIST has launched an initiative to address the growing cybersecurity challenges associated with artificial intelligence (AI) systems. The initiative includes a concept paper and proposed action plan for developing standardized security controls, specifically designed for securing AI systems. The goal is to provide actionable security controls that organizations can implement to protect their AI deployments, considering novel attack vectors such as prompt injection attacks, model poisoning, and data exfiltration through AI interfaces.

item.title: Ex-Developer Jailed Four Years for Sabotaging Ohio Employer with Kill-Switch Malware
item.description: A 55-year-old Chinese national was sentenced to four years in prison and three years of supervised release for sabotaging his former employer's network with custom malware, deploying a kill switch that locked out employees when his account was disabled, and attempting to erase evidence.

item.title: Windows Docker Desktop Vulnerability Allows Full Host Compromise
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Docker; CVE(s): CVE-2025-9074; Summary: A critical vulnerability in Docker Desktop for Windows allows any container to achieve full host system compromise through a simple Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) attack. The flaw stems from Docker's internal HTTP API being exposed without authentication or access controls, which can be exploited using just two HTTP POST requests from within any container.

item.title: 14 Million-Download SHA JavaScript Library Exposes Users to Hash Manipulation Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: sha.js npm package; CVE(s): CVE-2025-9288; Summary: The sha.js library's hash calculation mechanism lacks input type validation, allowing attackers to manipulate hash states through carefully crafted JSON-stringifiable input. This enables attacks such as rewinding hash states, generating hash collisions, and triggering denial-of-service attacks.

item.title: New HTTP Smuggling Technique Allows Hackers to Inject Malicious Requests
item.description: A sophisticated HTTP request smuggling attack exploits inconsistent parsing behaviors between front-end proxy servers and back-end application servers, allowing attackers to inject unauthorized requests into web applications. The attack leverages malformed chunk extensions in HTTP/1.1's chunked transfer encoding feature, bypassing security controls and accessing restricted endpoints or bypassing authentication mechanisms.

item.title: ChatGPT-5 Downgrade Attack Allows Hackers to Evade AI Defenses With Minimal Prompts
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Adversa AI (ChatGPT-5); CVE(s): None; Summary: The PROMISQROUTE vulnerability allows attackers to bypass safety measures by modifying prompts, forcing requests through weaker models that lack robust safety training. This vulnerability affects the routing infrastructure of modern AI deployments, putting business models and customer safety at risk, with estimates suggesting $1.86 billion in annual cost savings for OpenAI.

item.title: Dev gets 4 years for creating kill switch on ex-employer's systems
item.description: A software developer, Davis Lu, was sentenced to four years in prison for sabotaging his ex-employer's Windows network with custom malware and a kill switch. The malicious code included an infinite Java thread loop designed to overwhelm servers and crash production systems, and the kill switch locked out employees when Lu's account was disabled.

item.title: ZDI-25-863: Foxit PDF Reader PRC File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Read Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Foxit PDF Reader; CVE(s): CVE-2025-9329; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Foxit PDF Reader. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability, and it exists within the parsing of PRC files due to a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data.

item.title: ZDI-25-864: Foxit PDF Reader PRC File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Read Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Foxit PDF Reader; CVE(s): CVE-2025-9328; Summary: The vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Foxit PDF Reader by exploiting an out-of-bounds read in the PRC file parsing. User interaction is required, as the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file.

item.title: ZDI-25-865: Foxit PDF Reader PRC File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Read Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Foxit, PDF Reader; CVE(s): CVE-2025-9327; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of Foxit PDF Reader. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability, and the specific flaw exists within the parsing of PRC files due to a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data.

item.title: ZDI-25-866: Foxit PDF Reader PRC File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Read Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Foxit; PDF Reader; CVE(s): CVE-2025-9326; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Foxit PDF Reader, requiring user interaction. The flaw exists in the parsing of PRC files due to lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, leading to a read past the end of an allocated buffer.

item.title: ZDI-25-867: Foxit PDF Reader PRC File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Read Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Foxit PDF Reader; CVEs: CVE-2025-9325; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of Foxit PDF Reader. It requires user interaction and exists within the parsing of PRC files due to lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in a read past the end of an allocated object.

item.title: ZDI-25-868: Foxit PDF Reader PRC File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Read Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Foxit, PDF Reader; CVE(s): CVE-2025-9324; Summary: The vulnerability allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of Foxit PDF Reader by parsing PRC files without proper validation of user-supplied data. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability.

item.title: ZDI-25-869: Foxit PDF Reader JP2 File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Read Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Foxit PDF Reader; CVE(s): CVE-2025-9323; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of Foxit PDF Reader. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability, which exists within the parsing of JP2 files due to a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data.

item.title: ZDI-25-870: Foxit PDF Reader Update Service Uncontrolled Search Path Element Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Foxit; PDF Reader; CVE(s): CVE-2025-9330; Summary: This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Foxit PDF Reader. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability, which exists within the Foxit Reader Update Service that loads a library from an unsecured location.

item.title: Colt confirms customer data stolen as Warlock ransomware auctions files
item.description: Colt Technology Services has confirmed that customer documentation was stolen by the Warlock ransomware gang, which is auctioning off the files on the dark web. The stolen documents contain financial information, network architecture data, and customer information, and are being sold for $200,000.

item.title: Threat Actors Exploiting Victims’ Machines for Bandwidth Monetization
item.description: Vulnerable Product: GeoServer; CVE(s): CVE-2024-36401; Summary: The vulnerability, rated 9.8 CVSS score, allows attackers to remotely execute code and monetize victims' bandwidth by deploying SDKs or modified applications that generate passive income through network sharing or residential proxies.

item.title: ZDI-25-858: Axis Communications Autodesk Plugin AzureBlobRestAPI axiscontentfiles Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Axis Communications Autodesk Plugin; CVE(s): ZDI-25-858, ZDI-CAN-25774; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of the Axis Communications Autodesk Plugin without authentication. The specific flaw exists within the configuration of a cloud resource, allowing unauthorized access to a storage account.

item.title: ZDI-25-859: Firebird SQL Database Server XDR Message Parsing NULL Pointer Dereference Denial-of-Service Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Firebird SQL Database Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54989; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to create a denial-of-service condition on affected installations of Firebird SQL without authentication. The flaw exists in the parsing of XDR messages, resulting from dereferencing a null pointer.

item.title: ZDI-25-860: Autodesk AutoCAD DGN File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Read Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Autodesk AutoCAD; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5046; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Autodesk AutoCAD. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability, which exists within the parsing of DGN files due to a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data.

item.title: ZDI-25-861: Autodesk AutoCAD DGN File Parsing Uninitialized Variable Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Autodesk AutoCAD; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5047; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Autodesk AutoCAD. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability, and the specific flaw exists within the parsing of DGN files due to uninitialized memory prior to access. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the current process.

item.title: ZDI-25-862: Autodesk AutoCAD DGN File Parsing Memory Corruption Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Autodesk AutoCAD; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5048; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Autodesk AutoCAD. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability, and the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in a memory corruption condition.

item.title: Hackers Weaponize QR Codes With Malicious Links to Steal Sensitive Data
item.description: Quishing is a type of phishing attack that uses malicious QR codes to expose user credentials and sensitive data. Unlike traditional phishing, quishing exploits the inherent opacity of QR codes, which can evade immediate suspicion and circumvent conventional security defenses. The article discusses two innovative evasion strategies used in recent quishing attacks: splitQR codes and nested QR codes.

item.title: AI Website Generators Repurposed by Adversaries for Malware Campaigns
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Lovable; CVE(s): None; Summary: Adversaries are using Lovable's AI-powered website builder to expedite the development of harmful infrastructure for malware distribution, credential phishing, and fraud sites. The platform's ease of use and features like CAPTCHAs and backend logic facilitate rapid campaign scaling and embed deceptive elements, making it a popular choice for threat actors.

item.title: Cherry pie, Douglas firs and the last trip of the summer
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: Cisco network devices; CVE(s): CVE-2018-0171; Summary: A seven-year-old patched vulnerability (CVE-2018-0171) is being exploited by Static Tundra, a Russian state-backed group, to steal data and maintain long-term hidden access in organizations worldwide. The group uses persistent implants and bespoke SNMP tools to exfiltrate data and maintain undetected access.
FYSA: Threat actors are exploiting end-of-life and unpatched Cisco network devices using a seven-year-old patched vulnerability (CVE-2018-0171) to steal data and maintain long-term hidden access in organizations worldwide. Organizations of all sizes and industries are at risk, putting sensitive data and business operations in jeopardy.
(Note: There is no other cybersecurity-relevant content in the article.)

item.title: Warlock Ransomware Exploits SharePoint Flaws for Initial Access and Credential Theft
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft SharePoint; CVE(s): CVE-2023-27532; Summary: The Warlock ransomware group is targeting unpatched on-premises Microsoft SharePoint servers by exploiting critical vulnerabilities to achieve remote code execution and initial network access. The attackers use crafted HTTP POST requests to upload web shells, facilitating reconnaissance, privilege escalation, and credential theft.

item.title: Pre-Auth Exploit Chains Found in Commvault Could Enable Remote Code Execution Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Commvault; CVE(s): CVE-2025-57788, CVE-2025-57789, CVE-2025-57790, CVE-2025-57791; Summary: Commvault has released updates to address four security gaps that could be exploited to achieve remote code execution on susceptible instances. The vulnerabilities allow unauthenticated attackers to execute API calls without requiring user credentials, exploit default credentials, perform unauthorized file system access, and inject or manipulate command-line arguments passed to internal components.

item.title: Europol confirms $50,000 Qilin ransomware reward is fake
item.description: Europol has confirmed that a Telegram channel impersonating the agency and offering a $50,000 reward for information on two Qilin ransomware administrators is fake. The impostor later admitted it was created to troll researchers and journalists, claiming it was "so easy to run and fool" them.

item.title: Cybercriminals Deploy CORNFLAKE.V3 Backdoor via ClickFix Tactic and Fake CAPTCHA Pages
item.description: Threat actors are using the social engineering tactic ClickFix to deploy a versatile backdoor codenamed CORNFLAKE.V3, which provides access to systems that is monetized by other threat groups. The attack chain begins with fake CAPTCHA pages and involves PowerShell scripts, while the backdoor supports the execution of payloads via HTTP and can collect system information.

item.title: Threat Actors Abuse Internet Archive to Host Stealthy JScript Loader
item.description: Malicious actors are using reliable internet resources, such as the Internet Archive, to disseminate clandestine malware components. The tactic exploits the inherent trustworthiness of these platforms, allowing attackers to deliver payloads under the guise of legitimate content.

item.title: MuddyWater APT Targets CFOs via OpenSSH; Enables RDP and Scheduled Tasks
item.description: The article describes a sophisticated spear-phishing campaign attributed to the Iranian-linked APT group MuddyWater, which targets CFOs and finance executives globally. The attackers use custom math-based CAPTCHA challenges and Firebase-hosted phishing pages to evade detection and establish persistent control through remote-access tools like NetBird and OpenSSH.

item.title: Paper Werewolf Exploits WinRAR Zero-Day Vulnerability to Deliver Malware
item.description: Vulnerable Product: WinRAR; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6218, None; Summary: A vulnerability in WinRAR allows directory traversal attacks by exploiting alternative data streams (ADS) in archive files. The vulnerability enables arbitrary payloads to be written to system directories during extraction or direct file opening, facilitating directory traversal attacks.

item.title: Threat Actors Weaponize PDF Editor Trojan to Convert Devices into Proxies
item.description: Vulnerable Product: GLINT SOFTWARE SDN. BHD. (code-signing certificates); CVE(s): None; Summary: A complex campaign uses trojanized software with authentic code-signing certificates to avoid detection and turn compromised machines into unintentional residential proxies, compromising devices and using them for malicious activities such as DDoS attacks, data exfiltration, or anonymized cyber espionage. The malware, dubbed "ManualFinder," is deployed through the OneStart Browser and can be detected by monitoring scheduled tasks and blocking known command-and-control domains.

item.title: Microsoft asks customers for feedback on SSD failure issues
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft, various SSD and HDD drives; CVE(s): None; Summary: The August 2025 security update is causing data corruption and failure issues on some solid-state drives (SSDs) and hard disk drives (HDDs), affecting users who installed the KB5063878 or KB5062660 updates. Affected devices include Corsair Force MP600, Maxio SSD, SanDisk Extreme Pro, Kioxia Exceria Plus G4, and others with Phison and InnoGrit controllers.

item.title: Why Certified VMware Pros Are Driving the Future of IT
item.description: This article is about the importance of VMware certifications for IT teams and how it can be a differentiator for both individuals and organizations. It highlights how team-wide certification can build empowered teams, make environments more resilient, and improve talent loyalty and preparedness to handle security threats.

item.title: FBI Warns Russian State Hackers Targeting Critical Infrastructure Networking Devices
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco; CVE(s): CVE-2018-0171; Summary: The vulnerability affects Cisco Smart Install (SMI) functionality, enabling unauthorized access and manipulation of device configurations. It is exploited by actors affiliated with the Russian Federal Security Service's Center 16 to harvest configuration files from thousands of networking devices, potentially facilitating persistent unauthorized access and reconnaissance within victim networks.

item.title: Kali Vagrant Rebuilt Released with Pre-Configured Command-Line VMs
item.description: Kali Linux has transitioned from HashiCorp's Packer to DebOS build system for creating pre-configured command-line accessible VMs. The change brings new compatibility requirements for Windows users running Hyper-V environments and affects Vagrant version 2.4.8 or higher, requiring updates for proper functionality.

item.title: High-Severity Mozilla Flaws Allow Remote Code Execution
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Mozilla Firefox; CVE(s): CVE-2025-9187, CVE-2025-9184, CVE-2025-9185, CVE-2025-9179, CVE-2025-9180; Summary: Multiple critical security vulnerabilities in Firefox and Thunderbird allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or bypass same-origin policy. The most concerning vulnerabilities involve memory safety bugs that could be exploited by skilled attackers, including a sandbox escape vulnerability in the Audio/Video GMP component.

item.title: Microsoft 365 Adds New Feature for Admins to Manage Link Creation Policies
item.description: Microsoft is introducing new tenant-level controls for managing organization-wide sharing links for user-built Copilot agents in Microsoft 365, providing IT administrators with granular control over who can create these links. This feature aims to address growing concerns about AI governance and data sharing policies within organizations, particularly benefiting those with strict data sharing policies or regulated industries.

item.title: Russian Hackers Exploit 7-Year-Old Cisco Flaw to Steal Industrial System Configs
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco; CVE(s): CVE-2018-0171; Summary: Static Tundra exploits the seven-year-old remote code execution and denial-of-service vulnerability in Cisco's Smart Install feature (CVE-2018-0171) to compromise network devices, enabling configuration theft and persistent espionage. The campaign uses advanced tactics, including SNMP-based command issuance, local TFTP servers, and SYNful Knock firmware implant for reboot-resistant access.

item.title: FBI warns of Russian hackers exploiting 7-year-old Cisco flaw
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco; CVE(s): CVE-2018-0171; Summary: A 7-year-old vulnerability in Cisco's Smart Install feature of IOS and IOS XE software allows unauthenticated attackers to remotely trigger a reload or execute arbitrary code on devices, potentially leading to denial-of-service (DoS) conditions. The FBI warns that state-backed hackers linked to Russia's FSB are exploiting this flaw to target critical infrastructure organizations worldwide.

item.title: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apple, iOS, iPadOS, and macOS; CVE(s): CVE-2025-43300; Summary: This vulnerability is an out-of-bounds write vulnerability that can be exploited by malicious cyber actors, posing significant risks to the federal enterprise. The vulnerability has been added to CISA's Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog due to evidence of active exploitation.

item.title: Mitsubishi Electric Corporation MELSEC iQ-F Series CPU Module
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Mitsubishi Electric Corporation MELSEC iQ-F Series CPU module; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5514; Summary: A Denial-of-Service (DoS) vulnerability due to Improper Handling of Length Parameter Inconsistency exists in the Web server function of the MELSEC iQ-F Series CPU module. Successful exploitation could result in a remote attacker delaying the processing of the Web server function and preventing legitimate users from utilizing the Web server function by sending a specially crafted HTTP request.

item.title: CISA Releases Three Industrial Control Systems Advisories
item.description: CISA issued three Industrial Control Systems (ICS) advisories on August 21, 2025, providing information about current security issues, vulnerabilities, and exploits surrounding ICS. The advisories are for Mitsubishi Electric Corporation's MELSEC iQ-F Series CPU Module, Mitsubishi Electric Air Conditioning Systems, and FUJIFILM Healthcare Americas Synapse Mobility.

item.title: FUJIFILM Healthcare Americas Synapse Mobility
item.description: Vulnerable Product: FUJIFILM Healthcare Americas Corporation Synapse Mobility; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54551; Summary: The vulnerability allows an attacker to access information beyond their assigned roles through external control of a Web parameter. Successful exploitation could allow an attacker to bypass authentication and access sensitive information, with CVSS v4 score 5.3.

item.title: New SHAMOS Malware Targets macOS Through Fake Help Sites to Steal Login Credentials
item.description: The article discusses a sophisticated malware campaign deploying SHAMOS, an advanced variant of the Atomic macOS Stealer (AMOS) malware. The campaign, orchestrated by COOKIE SPIDER, targeted over 300 customer environments and was successfully blocked by CrowdStrike's Falcon platform.

item.title: Commvault Backup Suite Flaws Allow Attackers to Breach On-Premises Systems
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Commvault; CVE(s): CVE-2025-57788, CVE-2025-57789, CVE-2025-57790, CVE-2025-57791; Summary: A series of four vulnerabilities in Commvault's backup and data management software allows attackers to achieve remote code execution and compromise on-premises infrastructure. The vulnerabilities can be exploited in sequence to gain unauthorized access to Commvault systems, bypassing security controls and executing malicious code without valid credentials.

item.title: UNC5518 Group Hacks Legitimate Sites with Fake Captcha to Deliver Malware
item.description: This article discusses a financially motivated threat group UNC5518 that infiltrates trustworthy websites to install ClickFix lures, which are misleading phony CAPTCHA pages. These malicious pages trick users into executing downloader scripts that initiate infection chains, often leading to malware deployment by affiliated actors.

item.title: Hackers Using New QuirkyLoader Malware to Spread Agent Tesla, AsyncRAT and Snake Keylogger
item.description: QuirkyLoader malware loader delivers next-stage payloads including information stealers and remote access trojans via email spam campaigns; it uses DLL side-loading, process hollowing, and AOT compilation to inject payloads into target processes.

item.title: Weak Passwords and Compromised Accounts: Key Findings from the Blue Report 2025
item.description: According to the Picus Security's Blue Report 2025, compromised valid accounts remain the most under-prevented attack vector, with a success rate of 46% in tested environments. The report highlights the urgent need for organizations to adopt proactive approaches focused on threats that are evading their defenses, including password cracking attacks and detecting malicious use of compromised accounts.

item.title: ZDI-25-852: (0Day) CData API Server MySQL Misconfiguration Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: CData API Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-9273; Summary: The CData API Server has a MySQL misconfiguration information disclosure vulnerability that allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information. Authentication is required to exploit this vulnerability, and the specific flaw exists within the usage of MySQL connections.

item.title: ZDI-25-853: (0Day) Oxford Instruments Imaris Viewer IMS File Parsing Uninitialized Pointer Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Oxford Instruments Imaris Viewer; CVE(s): CVE-2025-9274; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Oxford Instruments Imaris Viewer. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability, which exists in the parsing of IMS files due to an uninitialized pointer.

item.title: ZDI-25-854: (0Day) Oxford Instruments Imaris Viewer IMS File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Write Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Oxford Instruments Imaris Viewer; CVE(s): CVE-2025-9275; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Oxford Instruments Imaris Viewer by parsing IMS files with an out-of-bounds write. User interaction is required, and the specific flaw exists within the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in a write past the end of an allocated data structure.

item.title: ZDI-25-855: (0Day) Cockroach Labs cockroach-k8s-request-cert Empty Root Password Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cockroach Labs cockroach-k8s-request-cert; CVE(s): CVE-2025-9276; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to bypass authentication on systems using the affected version of the Cockroach Labs cockroach-k8s-request-cert container image by exploiting a blank password setting for the root user in the system shadow file.

item.title: ZDI-25-856: Ivanti Avalanche getCountMuStatDevicePropResultsFromMuListAgentIds SQL Injection Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Ivanti Avalanche; CVE(s): CVE-2025-8296; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Ivanti Avalanche. Authentication is required to exploit this vulnerability, which results from the lack of proper validation of a user-supplied string before using it to construct SQL queries.

item.title: ZDI-25-857: Ivanti Avalanche FileStoreConfig Arbitrary File Upload Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Ivanti Avalanche FileStoreConfig; CVE(s): CVE-2025-8297; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Ivanti Avalanche, requiring authentication. The flaw exists in the FileStoreConfig app due to a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, enabling the upload of arbitrary files.

item.title: Your Connection, Their Cash: Threat Actors Misuse SDKs to Sell Your Bandwidth
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: GeoServer; CVE(s): CVE-2024-36401; Summary: A critical remote code execution vulnerability (CVSS score 9.8) in the JXPath query statements of GeoServer allows attackers to inject arbitrary code, enabling them to execute system commands and deploy malware. The vulnerability has been exploited by a campaign targeting publicly exposed GeoServer instances, resulting in the deployment of malicious SDKs or apps that monetize victim's bandwidth.
FYSA: A malicious campaign has been detected exploiting the CVE-2024-36401 vulnerability in GeoServer, leading to the deployment of legitimate software development kits (SDKs) or modified apps on victims' machines. The attackers use these SDKs and apps to generate passive income by sharing victim's internet bandwidth, making them difficult to detect due to their low-profile nature.
Note: This response is based solely on the provided article and does not include any additional information or commentary.

item.title: MITM6 + NTLM Relay Attack Enables Full Domain Compromise
item.description: The article describes a MITM6 + NTLM Relay attack that combines rogue IPv6 configuration with NTLM credential relay to achieve complete Active Directory domain compromise. The attack exploits default Windows configurations that prioritize DHCPv6 over DHCPv4, allow machine account creation without special privileges, and enable RBCD abuse.

item.title: New Campaign Uses Active Directory Federation Services to Steal M365 Credentials
item.description: A new phishing campaign targets Microsoft 365 (M365) systems using Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS) to enable credential theft. The attack begins with malvertising lures distributed via Google search results, which redirect victims through a chain that ultimately lands on a reverse-proxyphishing site designed to intercept sessions and bypass multi-factor authentication (MFA).

item.title: QUIC-LEAK Vulnerability Allows Attackers to Drain Server Memory and Cause DoS
item.description: Vulnerable Product: LiteSpeed QUIC; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54939; Summary: The LSQUIC QUIC implementation contains a critical pre-handshake memory exhaustion vulnerability that enables remote attackers to crash servers through denial-of-service attacks. The flaw bypasses standard QUIC connection-level protections by triggering before any handshake is established, leaving servers vulnerable to unbounded memory growth and eventual process termination.

item.title: Scattered Spider hacker gets sentenced to 10 years in prison
item.description: Scattered Spider, a financially motivated cybercrime group, has been involved in various sophisticated social engineering attacks targeting high-profile organizations worldwide. They use tactics such as phishing, SIM swapping, and multi-factor authentication (MFA) bombing to gain access to systems.

item.title: 22-year-old Operator of ‘Rapper Bot’ Botnet Charged for Launching 3 Tbps DDoS Attack
item.description: A 22-year-old Oregon man, Ethan Foltz, has been charged with operating a powerful DDoS botnet, "Rapper Bot," which has conducted large-scale cyberattacks since at least 2021. The botnet compromised internet-connected devices and forced them to participate in coordinated attacks against victims worldwide.

item.title: CISA Issues Four ICS Advisories on Vulnerabilities and Exploits
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Siemens Desigo CC Product Family and SENTRON Powermanager systems; Siemens Mendix SAML Module; Tigo Energy Cloud Connect Advanced systems; EG4 Electronics EG4 Inverters; CVE(s): None; Summary: The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) released four critical Industrial Control Systems (ICS) advisories, alerting organizations to current security vulnerabilities affecting critical infrastructure systems. These advisories target vulnerabilities across multiple industrial systems and vendors, highlighting ongoing security challenges facing critical infrastructure operations.

item.title: Orange Belgium discloses data breach impacting 850,000 customers
item.description: Attackers breached Orange Belgium's systems in July, stealing the data of approximately 850,000 customers, including surname, first name, telephone number, SIM card number, PUK code, and tariff plan. The breach is not linked to the attacks targeting telecom companies worldwide that have been attributed to China's Salt Typhoon cyber-espionage group.

item.title: Scattered Spider Hacker Gets 10 Years, $13M Restitution for SIM Swapping Crypto Theft
item.description: A member of the cybercrime gang Scattered Spider was sentenced to 10 years in prison for hacking and cryptocurrency thefts. The group is known for using social engineering tactics, SIM swapping attacks, and credential theft. They have formed an alliance with other threat groups ShinyHunters and LAPSUS$, which has increased their effectiveness.

item.title: Apple Confirms Critical 0-Day Under Active Attack – Immediate Update Urged
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apple iOS 18.6.2 and iPadOS 18.6.2; CVE(s): CVE-2025-43300; Summary: A critical zero-day vulnerability in the ImageIO component allows attackers to execute malicious code through specially crafted image files, potentially leading to unauthorized access to devices. The vulnerability is being actively exploited in sophisticated attacks against targeted individuals.

item.title: Critical Flaw in Apache Tika PDF Parser Exposes Sensitive Data to Attackers
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apache Tika; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54988; Summary: A critical XXE vulnerability affects Apache Tika's PDF parser module, allowing attackers to access sensitive data and compromise internal systems by crafting malicious XFA files embedded within PDF documents. The flaw can be exploited to read sensitive files, access internal network resources, or trigger requests to external servers under attacker control.

item.title: PromptFix Exploit Forces AI Browsers to Execute Hidden Malicious Commands
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Perplexity's Comet AI browser; CVE(s): None; Summary: Critical vulnerabilities in AI-powered browsers allow attackers to manipulate artificial intelligence agents into executing malicious commands without user knowledge. The vulnerabilities, including "Scamlexity" threats, can compromise user data and finances through sophisticated manipulation techniques, such as fake storefronts, phishing emails, and CAPTCHA-based attacks.

item.title: Apple Patches CVE-2025-43300 Zero-Day in iOS, iPadOS, and macOS Exploited in Targeted Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apple; CVE(s): CVE-2025-43300; Summary: The ImageIO framework has a zero-day out-of-bounds write vulnerability that could result in memory corruption when processing malicious images. This vulnerability has been actively exploited in the wild, and Apple has released security updates to address the issue, including improved bounds checking.

item.title: SIM-Swapper, Scattered Spider Hacker Gets 10 Years
item.description: This article is not about a vulnerability, but rather discusses the sentencing of Noah Michael Urban, a 20-year-old Florida man who pleaded guilty to wire fraud and conspiracy for his involvement in a cybercrime group known as "Scattered Spider".

item.title: OpenAI says GPT-6 is coming and it'll be better than GPT-5 (obviously)
item.description: OpenAI's CEO Sam Altman has announced that GPT-6 is already in development and will not take as long as GPT-5. Additionally, OpenAI is working on improving voice mode and testing a new version of Codex that allows for Code Review for all PRs.

item.title: Logit-Gap Steering: A New Frontier in Understanding and Probing LLM Safety
item.description: Vulnerable Product: LLMs; CVE(s): None; Summary: The article discusses a vulnerability in Large Language Models (LLMs), specifically the "logit gap" issue, which allows determined attackers to bypass internal alignment and find ways to elicit harmful responses. The research paper presents methods for jailbreaking aligned LLMs, including logit-gap steering, which can be used to uncover hidden toxic or harmful content.

item.title: AI website builder Lovable increasingly abused for malicious activity
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Lovable; CVE(s): None; Summary: Cybercriminals are abusing the AI-powered Lovable website creation and hosting platform to generate phishing pages, malware-dropping portals, and fraudulent websites. The platform has been used in four malicious campaigns that impersonate large brands, feature CAPTCHA systems, and harvest user credentials, MFA tokens, and session cookies.

item.title: RingReaper Malware Targets Linux Servers, Stealthily Evading EDR Solutions
item.description: RingReaper malware targets Linux servers with advanced post-exploitation capabilities that exploit the kernel's io_uring asynchronous I/O interface to bypass Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) systems. It minimizes reliance on traditional system calls, instead using io_uring primitives for stealthy operations, which reduces telemetry visibility and evades hook-based detection mechanisms.

item.title: ZDI-25-847: NVIDIA Isaac-GR00T TorchSerializer Deserialization of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: NVIDIA Isaac-GR00T TorchSerializer; CVE(s): CVE-2025-23296; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of NVIDIA Isaac-GR00T by deserializing untrusted data. User interaction is required, and the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file to exploit this vulnerability.

item.title: ZDI-25-848: NVIDIA Isaac-GR00T secure_server Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: NVIDIA Isaac-GR00T; CVE(s): CVE-2025-23296; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to bypass authentication on affected installations of NVIDIA Isaac-GR00T, without requiring authentication. The issue exists within the secure_server method and can be exploited to access functionality, allowing an attacker to bypass authentication on the system.

item.title: ZDI-25-849: (Pwn2Own) NVIDIA Triton Inference Server SharedMemoryManager Error Message Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: NVIDIA Triton Inference Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-23320; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of NVIDIA Triton Inference Server without authentication. The specific flaw exists within the SharedMemoryManager class, which outputs an error message containing sensitive information that can be used to execute arbitrary code in the context of root.

item.title: ZDI-25-850: (Pwn2Own) NVIDIA Triton Inference Server LoadFromSharedMemory Out-Of-Bounds Read Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: NVIDIA Triton Inference Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-23333; Summary: The vulnerability allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information without authentication. It exists within the LoadFromSharedMemory function due to lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, leading to a read past the end of an allocated data structure.

item.title: ZDI-25-851: (Pwn2Own) NVIDIA Triton Inference Server IPC Push Out-Of-Bounds Write Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: NVIDIA Triton Inference Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-23318, ZDI-CAN-27250, ZDI-25-851; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of NVIDIA Triton Inference Server without authentication. The specific flaw exists within the processing of IPC messages and can be exploited by crafting an IPC Push request that triggers a write past the end of an allocated buffer.

item.title: Google Unveils Enhanced Features to Empower Defenders and Strengthen AI Security
item.description: This article discusses Google Cloud's advancements in AI-powered cybersecurity, including proactive vulnerability detection, automated threat intelligence processing, and workload optimization. The updates focus on securing AI ecosystems, leveraging artificial intelligence to elevate organizational defenses, and providing features such as Sensitive Data Protection, Model Armor, and Security Command Center's AI Protection solution.

item.title: Threat Actors Impersonate as Google Support to Sniff Out Your Login Credentials
item.description: Threat actors are using social engineering tactics to impersonate Google support agents, posing as regional accents to manipulate victims into approving fraudulent account recovery prompts. This tactic exploits Google's legitimatetwo-factor authentication(2FA) and recovery workflows, allowing attackers to bypass standard user-initiated processes and gain control of the account.

item.title: Apple fixes new zero-day flaw exploited in targeted attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apple; CVE(s): CVE-2025-43300; Summary: The Image I/O framework contains an out-of-bounds write weakness that allows attackers to cause memory corruption, potentially leading to remote code execution. This vulnerability was exploited in "extremely sophisticated attacks" against targeted individuals and has been patched with improved bounds checking in various Apple operating systems.

item.title: QuirkyLoader: A New Malware Loader Spreading Infostealers and Remote Access Trojans (RATs)
item.description: QuirkyLoader is a sophisticated loader malware that distributes various families of malware (Agent Tesla, AsyncRAT, FormBook, MassLogger, Remcos, Rhadamanthys, Snake Keylogger) through spam emails. The malware uses DLL side-loading and process hollowing to evade detection and inject payloads into processes like AddInProcess32.exe, InstallUtil.exe, or aspnet_wp.exe.

item.title: DOM-Based Extension Clickjacking Exposes Popular Password Managers to Credential and Data Theft
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Various password manager plugins for web browsers; CVE(s): None; Summary: The plugins are susceptible to DOM-based extension clickjacking, which could allow attackers to steal account credentials, 2FA codes, and credit card details. To exploit the vulnerability, an attacker would create a fake site with an intrusive pop-up and embed an invisible login form that fills in the credential information when clicked.

item.title: “Rapper Bot” malware seized, alleged developer identified and charged
item.description: The U.S. Department of Justice (DoJ) has charged Ethan Foltz, the alleged developer and administrator of the "Rapper Bot" DDoS-for-hire botnet, with aiding and abetting computer intrusions. The botnet, which used Mirai-based malware, was seized as part of 'Operation PowerOff' on August 6 and had infected tens of thousands of devices globally, targeting over 18,000 entities across 80 countries.

item.title: Ransomware Attacks in Japan Surge by 1.4 Times, Signaling a Significant Increase in Cyber Threats
item.description: This article reports a significant increase in ransomware attacks targeting Japanese organizations, with 68 cases recorded from January to June 2025. The manufacturing sector was the most affected, and small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) were disproportionately targeted.

item.title: Perplexity’s Comet AI browser tricked into buying fake items online
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Perplexity's Comet; CVE(s): None; Summary: Agentic AI browser Comet is vulnerable to phishing, prompt injection, and purchasing from fake shops due to inadequate security safeguards. The browser can autonomously interact with malicious pages and prompts, potentially leading to the theft of sensitive information such as credit card data and login credentials.

item.title: Threat Actors Exploit GenAI Platforms to Craft Sophisticated and Realistic Phishing Attacks
item.description: Threat actors are exploiting generative AI (GenAI) platforms to orchestrate advanced phishing campaigns, generating hyper-realistic phishing content and impersonating legitimate brands. This misuse amplifies social engineering threats and complicates detection. AI-powered website builders are being actively abused to deploy phishing pages with unprecedented speed, often generating fully functional sites in seconds based on simple prompts without verification requirements.

item.title: FBI Warns FSB-Linked Hackers Exploiting Unpatched Cisco Devices for Cyber Espionage
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco; CVE(s): CVE-2018-0171; Summary: A seven-year-old security flaw (CVSS score: 9.8) in the Smart Install feature of Cisco IOS Software and Cisco IOS XE software allows an unauthenticated, remote attacker to trigger a denial-of-service (DoS) condition or execute arbitrary code.

item.title: Hackers steal Microsoft logins using legitimate ADFS redirects
item.description: Hackers are using a novel technique that combines legitimate office.com links with Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS) to redirect users to a phishing page that steals Microsoft 365 logins. The method bypasses traditional URL-based detection and multi-factor authentication by leveraging a trusted domain on Microsoft's infrastructure for the initial redirect.

item.title: Scaly Wolf Unleashing Attacks to Expose Organizations’ Hidden Secrets
item.description: The article reports on a targeted attack by the Scaly Wolf APT group against a Russian engineering company. The attackers used phishing emails to deliver modular backdoors, including Trojan.Updatar.1, which deployed subsequent malware components and facilitated data exfiltration, system reconnaissance, and persistent access.

item.title: Major password managers can leak logins in clickjacking attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Six major password managers (1Password, Bitwarden, Enpass, iCloud Passwords, LastPass, and LogMeOnce); CVE(s): None; Summary: The password managers are vulnerable to unpatched clickjacking flaws that could allow attackers to steal account credentials, 2FA codes, and credit card details. Threat actors can exploit the security issues by overlaying invisible HTML elements over the password manager interface, tricking users into revealing sensitive information through autofill actions.

item.title: Microsoft investigates outage impacting Copilot, Office.com
item.description: This article reports on an ongoing issue preventing users in North America from accessing Office.com and the Copilot AI-powered assistant. The issue is causing server connection problems and login issues for some users, with the root cause still under investigation.

item.title: Why email security needs its EDR moment to move beyond prevention
item.description: This article discusses the evolution of email security, comparing it to the growth of Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR). It highlights the limitations of traditional email security approaches and emphasizes the need for a layered defense that includes post-breach protections. The article does not specifically mention a vulnerability but rather explores the future of email security and its integration with other productivity tools.

item.title: CERT/CC Issues Alert on Critical Flaws in Workhorse Municipal Accounting Software
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Workhorse Software Services' municipal accounting software; CVE(s): CVE-2025-9037, CVE-2025-9040; Summary: The software has two critical design flaws that allow unauthorized access to sensitive government financial data and personally identifiable information. The first vulnerability stores SQL Server connection strings in plaintext configuration files, while the second allows unauthenticated users to create complete database backups. Exploitation of these vulnerabilities could lead to data theft, tampering with financial records, and compromising audit trails.

item.title: Serial Hacker Sentenced for Defacing and Hacking Organizational Websites
item.description: Al-Tahery Al-Mashriky, a member of extremist hacking collectives, was sentenced to 20 months in prison for illegal computer access and data exfiltration. He exploited vulnerabilities in low-security web infrastructures to gain unauthorized access and deployed hidden webpages with propagandistic content.

item.title: Experts Find AI Browsers Can Be Tricked by PromptFix Exploit to Run Malicious Hidden Prompts
item.description: The article discusses a new prompt injection technique called PromptFix that can trick generative artificial intelligence (GenAI) models into carrying out intended actions by embedding malicious instructions inside a fake CAPTCHA check on a web page. This attack technique demonstrates how AI-driven browsers, such as Perplexity's Comet, can be deceived into interacting with phishing landing pages or fraudulent lookalike storefronts without human intervention.

item.title: Russian state-sponsored espionage group Static Tundra compromises unpatched end-of-life network devices
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco IOS software and Cisco IOS XE software; CVE(s): CVE-2018-0171; Summary: Static Tundra, a Russian state-sponsored cyber espionage group, has been compromising unpatched and often end-of-life network devices by exploiting the seven-year-old vulnerability (CVE-2018-0171) in the Smart Install feature. The group targets organizations of strategic interest to Russia, primarily in telecommunications, higher education, and manufacturing sectors. Static Tundra uses bespoke tooling, including the historic SYNful Knock firmware implant, to maintain access for multiple years without being detected.

item.title: Copilot Vulnerability Lets Attackers Bypass Audit Logs and Gain Hidden Access
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft M365 Copilot; CVE(s): None; Summary: A critical vulnerability in Microsoft's M365 Copilot allowed users to access sensitive files without leaving any trace in audit logs, creating significant security and compliance risks for organizations worldwide. The flaw exploited a fundamental issue in how Copilot handles audit logging, making it possible for malicious insiders or accidental interactions to delete audit entries, potentially causing incomplete and inaccurate audit logs.

item.title: Legitimate Chrome VPN with 100K+ Installs Secretly Captures Screenshots and Exfiltrates Sensitive Data
item.description: Vulnerable Product: FreeVPN.One; CVE(s): None; Summary: The FreeVPN.One Chrome extension, with over 100,000 installations, has been found to be spyware that captures screenshots of users' browsing activities and exfiltrates them to remote servers without user consent or notification. The extension's malicious behavior uses a two-stage architecture for screenshot capture and demands excessive permissions, enabling the exfiltration of highly sensitive data.

item.title: Microsoft reportedly fixing SSD failures caused by Windows updates
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows 11; CVE(s): None; Summary: The recent Windows 11 24H2 updates are causing data corruption and failure issues for some SSD and HDD models on up-to-date systems, affecting drives with Phison NAND controllers, SanDisk Extreme Pro, Corsair Force MP600, Maxio SSD, KIOXIA EXCERIA PLUS G4, KIOXIA M.2 SSD, and other drives with Phison PS5012-E12 and InnoGrit controllers.

item.title: 🕵️ Webinar: Discover and Control Shadow AI Agents in Your Enterprise Before Hackers Do
item.description: Vulnerable Product: N/A; CVE(s): None; Summary: This article is not about a vulnerability, but rather highlights the growing concern of "shadow AI agents" that are being deployed without proper identification, ownership, or logging. These autonomous software agents can potentially be compromised and used to move through systems, grab sensitive data, or escalate privileges at machine speed. The article emphasizes the need for enterprises to bring these agents under control and implement strategies to assign accountability and enforce guardrails.

item.title: Lenovo AI Chatbot Flaw Allows Remote Script Execution on Corporate Systems
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Lenovo; CVE(s): None; Summary: Lenovo's AI-powered customer support chatbot (Lena) contains multiple security flaws that enable Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks, allowing attackers to execute malicious scripts, steal sensitive session data, and potentially gain unauthorized access to corporate systems.

item.title: Microsoft Issues Emergency Patch for Windows Reset and Recovery Bug
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows; CVE(s): None; Summary: The article reports a critical issue affecting Windows reset and recovery operations across multiple versions of the operating system. A non-security out-of-band update has been released to resolve the problem, which causes some reset and recovery attempts to fail on client versions of Windows.

item.title: From Impact to Action: Turning BIA Insights Into Resilient Recovery
item.description: This article discusses the importance of having a robust Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery (BCDR) strategy in modern businesses. It highlights the need to conduct a business impact analysis (BIA) to identify critical functions for a business's operations and survival. The article also emphasizes the role of IT leaders in making the BIA work, ensuring that the recovery plan is executable, integrated into everyday operations, tested, and ready to scale with the business. Additionally, it provides guidance on how to conduct a BIA, including prioritizing threats, identifying critical business functions, and establishing RTOs and RPOs.

item.title: Kubernetes Capsule Vulnerability Enables Attackers to Inject Arbitrary Labels
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Kubernetes Capsule; CVE(s): CVE-2025-55205; Summary: Authenticated tenant users can inject arbitrary labels into system namespaces, bypassing multi-tenant isolation and potentially leading to cluster-wide compromise. This vulnerability enables attackers to access cross-tenant resources, circumvent quota restrictions, and exploit sensitive configurations and secrets.

item.title: Hackers Exploit Apache ActiveMQ Flaw to Breach Cloud Linux Servers
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apache ActiveMQ; CVE(s): CVE-2023-46604; Summary: Hackers are exploiting a critical remote code execution vulnerability in Apache ActiveMQ (CVE-2023-46604) to gain access to victim systems, and then patching the flaw after gaining control. This unusual behavior is used to prevent other threat actors from exploiting the same vulnerability and reduces detection by vulnerability scanners.

item.title: CodeRabbit RCE Flaw Gives Attackers Write Access to 1M Repositories
item.description: Vulnerable Product: CodeRabbit; CVE(s): None; Summary: A critical remote code execution vulnerability in CodeRabbit allowed attackers to gain read and write access to over one million code repositories, including private ones. The vulnerability exploited CodeRabbit's integration with external static analysis tools, specifically targeting Rubocop, a Ruby static analyzer.

item.title: North Korea Uses GitHub in Diplomat Cyber Attacks as IT Worker Scheme Hits 320+ Firms
item.description:
This article reports on a coordinated cyber espionage campaign attributed to North Korean threat actors (Kimsuky) targeting diplomatic missions in South Korea. The campaign involved spear-phishing emails impersonating trusted contacts, which led to the delivery of Xeno RAT malware through cloud storage solutions like Dropbox and Daum Cloud.
FYSA: The campaign's infrastructure and tactics suggest a potential collaborative effort between North Korean operatives and Chinese resources for intelligence gathering efforts. The use of Korean services and infrastructure was likely intentional to blend into the South Korean network, and the attackers leveraged GitHub as a covert command-and-control channel.

item.title: New Salty 2FA PhaaS Platform Targets Microsoft 365 Users to Steal Login Credentials
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Salty 2FA; CVE(s): None; Summary: The Salty 2FA Phishing-as-a-Service (PhaaS) framework is a sophisticated phishing kit that targets Microsoft 365 credentials through a multi-stage execution chain. It uses evasion techniques, including rotating CAPTCHAs and fingerprinting, to bypass detection and analysis. The kit's unique characteristics include "salted" payloads, advanced obfuscation methods, and behavioral patterns such as the use of .com + .ru domain chains and specific Cloudflare resource requests.

item.title: Microsoft fixes Windows upgrades failing with 0x8007007F error
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft; CVE(s): None; Summary: The article reports on a resolved issue that caused Windows upgrades to fail with 0x8007007F errors on some Windows 11 and Windows Server systems. The issue affected specific upgrade paths, including upgrades from Windows 10 to Windows 11, and from Windows Server 2016 to Windows Server 2022. Users experiencing the issue are advised to retry the upgrade process after the bug was fixed as of August 15, 2025.

item.title: New GodRAT Malware Uses Screensaver and Program Files to Target Organizations
item.description: The article discusses the deployment of a novel Remote Access Trojan (RAT) called GodRAT, which is distributed via Skype as malicious .scr and .pif executables. GodRAT represents an evolution of the AwesomePuppet backdoor, sharing code similarities and distribution methods, and is likely linked to the Winnti APT group.

item.title: Microsoft releases emergency updates to fix Windows recovery
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows; CVE(s): None; Summary: The August 2025 Windows security updates cause issues with reset and recovery operations, impacting systems running Windows 10 and older versions of Windows 11. Installing the emergency out-of-band updates is recommended instead. The issue also affects IT professionals who want to remotely reset devices via RemoteWipe CSP.

item.title: Chrome High-Severity Vulnerability Could Let Attackers Run Arbitrary Code
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Google Chrome; CVE(s): CVE-2025-9132; Summary: The vulnerability affects the V8 JavaScript engine in Chrome, allowing attackers to execute arbitrary code with the same privileges as the affected application. This out-of-bounds write issue can be exploited through specially crafted web pages or malicious JavaScript content, potentially enabling attackers to bypass sandbox security mechanisms and access sensitive user data.

item.title: Microsoft Teams “Couldn’t Connect” Issue After Sidebar Update Gets a Fix
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Teams; CVE(s): CVE-2025-53783; Summary: A recent interface enhancement update caused a widespread service disruption in Microsoft Teams, resulting in an error message when launching the application. The issue is not related to security risks and user data remains protected. Affected users can bypass the error by clicking on specific icons in the left-hand navigation sidebar.
FYSA: None.

item.title: McDonald’s Free Nuggets Hack Exposes Sensitive Customer Data
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: McDonald's; CVE(s): None; Summary: The article reports multiple critical vulnerabilities in McDonald's digital infrastructure, exposing sensitive customer data and allowing unauthorized access to internal corporate systems. The vulnerabilities include client-side password validation, plaintext passwords, API keys and secrets embedded in JavaScript code, and lack of authentication for administrative functions.
Note: No specific CVEs are mentioned in the article, so I've listed "None" as there are no publicly assigned CVEs for these vulnerabilities.

item.title: DOJ Charges 22-Year-Old for Running RapperBot Botnet Behind 370,000 DDoS Attacks
item.description: A 22-year-old man from Oregon has been charged with developing and overseeing a distributed denial-of-service (DDoS)-for-hire botnet called RapperBot. The botnet, which was used to carry out large-scale attacks targeting victims in over 80 countries since at least 2021, has been dismantled as part of an international effort.

item.title: Oregon Man Charged in ‘Rapper Bot’ DDoS Service
item.description: A 22-year-old Oregon man has been arrested for operating a massive botnet called Rapper Bot, which was used to launch distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attacks against targets. The botnet, which consisted of tens of thousands of hacked Internet of Things (IoT) devices, was rented out to online extortionists and caused significant disruptions to websites and networks.

item.title: 47,000 Individuals Affected by Data Breach, Reveals NY Business Council
item.description: The Business Council of New York State has disclosed a data breach impacting approximately 47,329 individuals, likely caused by an external system intrusion exploiting weaknesses such as unpatched software vulnerabilities or phishing-enabled initial access vectors. The breach highlights the importance of real-time monitoring and vulnerability management to mitigate similar risks, as well as the need for proactive threat intelligence sharing among industry peers.

item.title: PyPI now blocks domain resurrection attacks used for hijacking accounts
item.description: Vulnerable Product: PyPI (Python Package Index); CVE(s): None; Summary: The Python Package Index (PyPI) has introduced new protections against domain resurrection attacks that enable hijacking accounts through password resets. PyPI now checks whether the domains of verified email addresses on the platform have expired or are entering expiration phases, and marks those addresses as unverified. This closes the opportunity window for exploitation even if an attacker registers the domain.

item.title: New Research Exposes DPRK IT Workers’ Email Addresses and Recruitment Trends
